Orbus Terrarum is the third studio album of electronic music artist The Orb released on Island Records in 1995.

Before leaving The Orb, member Kris Weston had begun work on Orbus Terrarum. However, when he left The Orb, German producer Thomas Fehlmann joined as a full-time studio member. The Orb, now consisting of Alex Paterson, Andy Hughes, and Fehlmann, finished producing Orbus Terrarum. Unlike previous albums by The Orb, Orbus Terrarum featured more ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œearthboundÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œorganicÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ sounds instead of the trippy science fiction themed music they had previously written. Orbus Terrarum further alienated many of the groupÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s fans as they had with Pomme Fritz, causing the album to only reach #20 on the UK charts, much lower than their previous albums.
